comments:
3.1 RC2

- opened a closed project: org.eclipse.ui.carbon
- got the following errors (for unrelated projects):

This may be due to recent changes for bug 98740.

I am not able to reproduce this. The exceptions will be properly handled so 
their is no impact on functionality (although they may require the user to 
manually reset the synchronize view). Can you give any more details of your 
setup that migh be helpful in reproducing this (or you could show it to me if 
it is reproducable for you).

I was able to get the following error. The general problem is that sync state 
accumulation does not do any locking so the state can change when information 
is being collected (not sure it that's what happened in Nick's case but it is 
here). As these cases come in, we should find the appropriate place to catch 
the exception and ignore it if it is for a closed project. We fail gracefully 
enough that we do not need to address this for 3.1.

I can reproduce it, every time I open or close that project.
I suspect the sync view needs to be open, with the closed projects being covered
by an open sync.

The stack in comment 2 looks like a different problem.
The first one involving Container.members() seems pretty clear to be caused by
the fix for bug 98740.  Apparently we should not be calling members() on closed
projects.

I agree. My point was that a pre-check would only catch some of the potential 
problems since it is also possible that the project is closed while the change 
is being processed. Also, in testing for this, I was unable to reproduce the 
failure you saw but got a slightly different one after several attempts, 
indicating to me that it is a timing issue and does notoccur all the time. As 
such, I didn't feel that a fix for 3.1 was required. If you disagree, let me 
know and we can discuss it.
